item.title: For the love of God, stop calling your AI a co-worker
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Generative AI comes in many forms. Increasingly, though, it’s marketed the same way: with human names and personas that make it feel less like code and more like a co-worker. A growing number of startups are anthropomorphizing AI to build trust fast — and soften its threat to human jobs. It’s dehumanizing, and it’s accelerating. […]

item.title: Elon Musk tries to stick to spaceships
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Elon Musk’s interview with CBS Sunday Morning seemed to get off to an awkward start, as reporter David Pogue asked the SpaceX CEO about his thoughts on his ally Donald Trump’s policies, including growing restrictions on international students. “I think we want to stick to the subject of the day, which is, like, spaceships, as […]

item.title: Thousands of Netflix fans gather for Tudum
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Netflix released a flurry of announcements and trailers around high-profile projects including “Squid Game,” “Wednesday,” and “Stranger Things 5” last night at its annual Tudum marketing event. While this year’s Tudum (made for the sound that plays when you open the app) was livestreamed for the first time on Netflix itself (as opposed to YouTube), […]

item.title: Early AI investor Elad Gil finds his next big bet: AI-powered rollups
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Elad Gil started betting on AI before most of the world took notice. By the time investors began grasping the implications of ChatGPT, Gil had already written seed checks to startups like Perplexity, Character.AI, and Harvey. Now, as the early winners of the AI wave become clearer, the renowned “solo” VC is increasingly focused on […]

item.title: Sam Altman biographer Keach Hagey explains why the OpenAI CEO was ‘born for this moment’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: In “The Optimist: Sam Altman, OpenAI, and the Race to Invent the Future,” Wall Street Journal reporter Keach Hagey examines our AI-obsessed moment through one of its key figures — Sam Altman, co-founder and CEO of OpenAI. Hagey begins with Altman’s Midwest upbringing, then takes readers through his career at startup Loopt, accelerator Y Combinator, […]

item.title: Day 4 of TechCrunch Sessions: AI Trivia Countdown — Flex your brain, score big on tickets
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Sessions: AI hits UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall on June 5 — and today’s your shot at AI trivia glory and two tickets for the price of one. Answer a few brain-busting questions on artificial intelligence, and if you ace it, you might just find a special promo code waiting in your inbox. Every day […]

item.title: Video game union announces first contract with Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Unionized quality assurance testers at video game holding company ZeniMax announced Friday that they have reached a tentative contract agreement with Microsoft, which acquired ZeniMax in 2021. This represents Microsoft’s first union contract in the United States. It’s been a little over two years since approximately 300 QA testers announced that they were unionizing through […]

item.title: 4 days to go: TechCrunch Sessions: AI is almost in session
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Artificial intelligence has no shortage of visionaries—but the ones who matter are executing. In 4 days, TechCrunch Sessions: AI brings those builders, researchers, funders, and enthusiasts under one roof at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall. This isn’t a parade of AI hype or a string of over-edited keynotes. It’s a single day designed for clarity, candor, […]

item.title: Left-leaning influencers embrace Bluesky without abandoning X, Pew says
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: It’s no surprise that many big, left-leaning social media accounts have recently joined Bluesky — but a new analysis from the Pew Research Center attempts to quantify that shift. This comes as an update to Pew’s news influencer report released in November 2024, which did not include Bluesky in its numbers. The report focused on […]

item.title: NAACP calls on Memphis officials to halt operations at xAI’s ‘dirty data center’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The NAACP is calling on local officials to halt operations at Colossus, the “supercomputer” facility operated by Elon Musk’s xAI in South Memphis. As reported in NBC News, leaders from the civil rights group sent a letter Thursday to the Shelby County Health Department and Memphis Light Gas and Water criticizing the organizations’ “lackadaisical approach […]

item.title: Meta plans to automate many of its product risk assessments
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: An AI-powered system could soon take responsibility for evaluating the potential harms and privacy risks of up to 90% of updates made to Meta apps like Instagram and WhatsApp, according to internal documents reportedly viewed by NPR. NPR says a 2012 agreement between Facebook (now Meta) and the Federal Trade Commission requires the company to […]

item.title: Week in Review: Perplexity Labs wants to do your work
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: We've got a ton of stories for you this week, including a new AI-powered browser from Arc; not one but TWO hacks; Gemini email summaries; and much more.

item.title: Space Forge raises $30M Series A to make chip materials in space
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Space Forge, a U.K. startup headquartered in Cardiff, Wales, recently raised a £22.6 million (approximately $30 million) Series A to make wafer materials in space, where unique conditions unlock new possibilities.

item.title: Day 3 of the TechCrunch Sessions: AI Trivia Countdown — Your next shot at winning big
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Sessions: AI hits UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall on June 5, and we’re kicking Day 3 of AI trivia into high gear. This is your chance to prove you know your stuff — and score a major ticket deal while you’re at it. Answer a few AI-focused trivia questions, and you could win two tickets […]

item.title: Google quietly released an app that lets you download and run AI models locally
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Last week, Google quietly released an app that lets users run a range of openly available AI models from the AI dev platform Hugging Face on their phones. Called Google AI Edge Gallery, the app is available for Android and will soon come to iOS. It allows users to find, download, and run compatible models […]

item.title: A guide to using Edits, Meta’s new CapCut rival for short-form video editing
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Meta shared that it was working on Edits in January after ByteDance-owned CapCut was removed from U.S. app stores.

item.title: Serious About AI? The conversations that count start in 5 days at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: In just 5 days, the sharpest minds in artificial intelligence will gather at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall for TechCrunch Sessions: AI—a one-day summit built for real insight, not recycled soundbites. Whether you’re training your first model or managing a multi-billion-dollar portfolio, this is where the future of AI feels tangible. Let’s be honest: AI has […]

item.title: Elon Musk is lobbying lawmakers on driverless vehicle rules
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Musk and others in his orbit have been calling members of Congress directly, according to Bloomberg.

item.title: Yep, X was down again
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: People reported that photos weren't loading, its banking service XMoney wasn't working, and search wasn't returning any results, among other things.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: A ride-sharing pioneer comes for Uber, Tesla loses more ground, and dog-like delivery robots land in Texas
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.
